title: WHAT LEADS YOU... GOD’S WILL OR SATAN’S TRICK?

memory_verse.label: Memory Verse
memory_verse.text: “Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways acknowledge Him, and He shall direct your paths.” (Proverbs 3:5-6)

devotion.label: Insight / Reflection
devotion.text:
A spiritual person always seeks God  asking, “Which way should I go?” and “When should I move?” He fully trusts and walks depending on the Lord. Lot looked at the fertile land of Sodom with his Carnal eyes. He didn’t pray or seek God’s direction before deciding. But David, in every step, asked God , “What should I do?” and “How should I go?” Therefore, he succeeded.
Saul, however, when he lost his relationship with God, sought help from a witch to know his way. The result  Saul died a tragic death on Mount Gilboa.
Even today, Satan approaches us with hidden tricks. He uses our pride, innocence, and ignorance to mislead us. This world is filled with lies and magical traps crafted by Satan. Every temptation and deceiving situation is shaped by evil spirits and demonic powers to make us fall.

So, we must live with spiritual wisdom and alertness, ready to overcome the enemy’s witchcraft and deception. Otherwise, we may get trapped and bewitched by his schemes. The devil can even use our own hands to blind our eyes.
Therefore, we must guard our ways carefully and stay close to God’s voice.

quote.label: Today's Quote
quote.text: “God’s guidance never confuses; it always leads to peace.”( Charles Spurgeon)

prayer.label: Prayer
prayer.text: Lord, help me to wait for Your voice before I move. Protect me from every trap of the enemy. May my heart always stay tuned to Your divine leading. Amen.

conclusion.label: A Word to You
text: May God give you the clarity to discern His will, and the humility and courage to follow it.
Walk in His good path  and you will never be deceived.

recommended_book.label: Recommended Book
recommended_book.title: Hearing God’s Voice
recommended_book.author: Henry Blackaby
recommended_book.quote: "People who make decisions based merely on what seems most advisable to them will inevitably choose something inferior to God's best ".
